revised_title: Band Structures of Conjugated One and Two Dimensional Polymers
tldr: The authors investigate the band structures of various one and two-dimensional conjugated polymers, focusing on their relation to unit cell constitution and geometrical disposition of atoms. They use the tight-binding scheme and extended Huckel method to calculate band structures and estimate the relative stabilities of different polymer configurations. The study covers polymers with carbon skeletons, including polyacetylene, polydiacetylene, polyphenylene, polyacene, and graphite, among others.
